Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk lftp
exit 0

exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: lftp bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The lftp packages provide a file transfer utility for FTP, SFTP, HTTP, and other commonly used protocols. The lftp utility uses the readline library for input, and provides support for bookmarks, built-in monitoring, job control, and parallel transfer of multiple files at the same time. This update fixes the following bugs: When running the lftp utility in mirror mode on a website, lftp terminated with an error in the cases with HTTP redirections with 302 status code. To fix this bug, lftp has been amended and now successfully proceeds to the new location in such situations. (BZ#1181580) Previously, the "help" command did not return the correct exit status. Consequently, if the "cmd:fail-exit" option was enabled, the lftp utility could terminate unexpectedly when another lftp command was executed after the "help" command. This bug has been fixed, and lftp no longer exits in this scenario. In addition, this update adds the following enhancement: With this update, lftp has the "ssl:priority" configuration option, which is used to allow and forbid specific versions of the SSL and TLS protocols. (BZ#1182987) Users of lftp are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add this enhancement. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
